content.question: Respond to all parts of the question. In your response, use substantive examples where appropriate. Identify the civil liberty that is common to both Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission (2010) and United States v. Eichman (1990). Explain how the reasoning in Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission and United States v. Eichman led to a similar holding in both cases. Explain how those unhappy with the precedent established in Eichman can use a constitutional process to have it overturned.
